articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Army Radio said on Saturday its military had targeted Hamas' military chief in a strike on Khan Younis in Gaza, in a strike that the enclave's health ministry said had killed at least 20 Palestinians.
articles.title: Israeli army radio says Hamas military chief targeted in Gaza strike

articles.author: Nathan Layne, Brendan Mcdermid, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Donald Trump was shot in the ear during a Saturday campaign rally, streaking the Republican presidential candidate's blood across his face and prompting his security agents to swarm him, before he emerged and pumped his fist in the air, appearing to mouth the words "Fight! Fight! Fight!"
articles.title: Trump shot in right ear at campaign rally, shooter dead

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Various world leaders on Saturday condemned the shooting at Donald Trump's rally in Pennsylvania in which the former president was shot in the right ear while one rally attendee and the shooter were left lead.
articles.title: World leaders condemn shooting at Trump rally, denounce political violence

articles.author: Sofia Christensen
articles.description: For Mariama Jarjou, taking her two daughters to a traditional circumciser when they were 5 and 4 was an act of love - a painful but important ritual that would give them status in their village and make them eligible for marriage.
articles.title: Insight: Gambia's bid to unban FGM divides families and parliament

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China expressed strong opposition on Saturday to a U.S. law signed by President Joe Biden that presses Beijing to resolve a dispute over Tibet's demands for greater autonomy, vowing to "firmly defend" its interests.
articles.title: China blasts US Tibet-China dispute bill, vows to defend its interests

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Laila Bassam
articles.description: Hamas' military leader Mohammed Deif, one of the masterminds behind what Israel termed its 9/11 moment, is an elusive figure who has rarely spoken and never appeared in public, and who has survived at least seven Israeli assassination attempts.
articles.title: Who is the Hamas military chief Mohammed Deif

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan's defence ministry said on Saturday it was monitoring "waves" of missile tests taking place in China's far northern region of Inner Mongolia and that its air defence forces were on alert.
articles.title: Taiwan on alert over 'waves' of missile tests in north China

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Pakistan court acquitted former Prime Minister Imran Khan and his wife on Saturday on charges of unlawful marriage, his lawyer said.
articles.title: Pakistan court acquits ex-PM Imran Khan, wife in unlawful marriage case, lawyer says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former U.S. President Donald Trump was out of hospital late on Saturday following a shooting earlier in the day at his rally where he was shot in the right ear, Bloomberg reported.
articles.title: Trump out of hospital, Bloomberg reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Gaza ceasefire talks have been halted after three days of intense negotiations failed to produce a viable outcome, two Egyptian security sources said on Saturday, blaming Israel for lacking a genuine intent to reach agreement.
articles.title: Gaza talks halted until Israel shows it's serious about negotiations, say Egyptian sources
